title: How is group decision- making different from individual decision-making? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let us take a simple example to understand the process. Say, there is a task of lifting a square shaped stone weighing 100 kg. If an individual is asked to do this task, he/she may not be able to perform it considering the individual’s capacity to perform such a laborious task. ( Please leave out the bodybuilders. Individuals are there who can perform such tasks such as Braun Strowman.) Now, if the same task is asked to perform to a group of 3–4 people, everyone will contribute towards how to complete it. And then, yes, it can be completed successfully. While coming to a conclusion over an issue/matter/problem/decision, every individual will sure have some capacities & limitation to look at the problem & come to a solution. But if the same situation is offered to a group of people to find a solution, there is no doubt that every individual will have a little different approach, perception & a solution too. After everyone have put individual’s opinion on the table, everyone can take out the best all they can find from everyone’s contribution & reach to the best possible solution to the problem. However, group decision making does not guarantee satisfaction to everyone involved in the process. As the outcome of such process is a mixture of mutually agreed upon positive factors contributed individually to find a most suitable solution, few or all may feel that their ideas were better than what others have given or what has been chosen at the end. The process basically leads to a win-win situation where everyone is either assured of minimal satisfaction or zero satisfaction. It may not be necessary that such process will have left a space for expressing displeasure over the outcome. Because, the phrase ‘Group Decision Making’ itself conveys that its a process which can have either positive or negative outcome. This is why either minimal satisfaction or entirely none but the process is carried out in the interest of larger good. If you ask me, its far better than letting an individual have the control over a particular situation or problem.
